title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ludwig Cancer Research
Interview Descriptions: It was overall super chill and met with the vice director and a project manager. I think she was more impressed by my resume than what I had to say in person.
Interview Questions: What past experiences brought you to this role?

title: Post-grad Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ludwig Cancer Research
Interview Descriptions: Face to face interview with presentation. had to give 30min presentation on previous research. Group panel of three asked questions. quite relaxed. Followed by tour of facility. Not much more to say. The questions were as you would expect. Why, how, what etc.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ludwig Cancer Research
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very relaxed and informal. A few postdocs interviewed me and asked general questions about my background and education. There were no technical questions so the interview felt more like a conversation about the research I had done in school. I had little direct experience in the specific field of research, so questions were focused on familiarity with general molecular biology concepts and work ethic.  Each person took about 15-30 minutes.

title: Associate Research Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Ludwig Cancer Research (La Jolla, CA) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: I had 2 interviews- one on phone and one in person with the PI. The phone interview consisted of describing my prior work experience, my skills, and my goals. The one-on-one interview was a more in-depth discussion on how my skills fit the position and what I will be expecting on the job. The interviews were very straight forward and organized.
Interview Questions: How would you make a 1L solution of _____ if you had a stock solution of _____concentration?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Ludwig Cancer Research (San Diego, CA) in Sept 2009
Interview Descriptions: After submitting my CV directly to the PI I was interested to work with I got an email to confirm I got the interview asking when I would have been available for a day at the lab. FOr the interview I was asked to present my past research to the lab and I got the opportunity to talk with my future boss about the issues I would have liked to study in the lab. I spent the rest of the day talking to the people who were already working there to get all the informations about the environment, the people and the atmosphere in the lab, in the rest of the institute and in the campus. As soon as the day was over I got the offer for the position.
Interview Questions: I did not have any difficulties or unexpected questions.

title: Postdoctoral Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Ludwig Cancer Research (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: The San Diego Branch of the Ludwig Institute for Cancer Research Ltd is located at the University of California, San Diego and affiliated with the UC San Diego Medical School and the Moore UC San Diego Cancer Center. The Branch is directed by Webster Cavenee, PhD. The seven groups at the San Diego Branch focus mainly on cancer genetics, cell signaling, gene regulation and mechanisms of cell division. The Branch has made important achievements investigating the processes that cells use to maintain the integrity of their genome, and how failure in these processes can lead to cancer
Interview Questions: what is your plan after you are done?
